articles.title: 'Endearing and fascinating' yellow-bellied glider faces 'inexorable slide' into extinction
articles.author: Graham Readfearn
articles.summary: The yellow-bellied glider is on an "inexorable slide" to extinction as global heating creates more extreme bushfires that are robbing the species of food and tree hollows it relies on to survive. The black summer bushfires of 2019-20 scorched 41% of their habitat and pushed them on to the national threatened species list in 2022.

articles.title: Chinese Study Reveals Rapid Tibetan Plateau Warming Ahead
articles.author: IANS
articles.summary: Tibetan Plateau is expected to experience accelerated warming in the next 10 years. Between 2025 and 2032, the region's annual mean temperature will rise by 0.98 degrees Celsius compared to the 1991-2020 baseline. This warming rate is 1.75 times faster than the observed increase from 2016 to 2023. The warming is projected to reduce glacier volume by 1.4 per cent, leading to faster melt rates.

articles.title: La Niña ends after 3 weak months, leaving Earth in neutral climate state
articles.author: CLOSE
articles.summary: After three months of La Niña, Earth is in a neutral setting in the El Niño–Southern Oscillation cycle. The neutral setting is generally the most benign of the three states that influence hurricane formation, droughts, floods, and global temperatures. La Niñas tend to be costlier than El Niños and neutral conditions.

articles.title: Marshall Islands President Heine talks surviving, thriving as rising seas threaten the RMI
articles.summary: Climate change and rising sea levels threaten to overtake the low-lying islands and atolls of the Republic of the Marshall Islands. President Hilda Heine was the keynote speaker at the 2025 University of Guam Conference on Island Sustainability on Friday. The RMI has developed a National Adaptation Plan, which Heine called the 'blueprint for survival' in the face of climate change.

articles.author: Gabe Whisnant
articles.summary: FEMA has denied North Carolina's request to extend the full reimbursement period for Hurricane Helene recovery efforts. Helene was the deadliest hurricane to hit the mainland U.S. since Katrina in 2005. It caused an estimated $8.4 billion in damages and 219 deaths. Trump and Kristi Noem want to eliminate FEMA.

articles.summary: Birds are masters of the air, the forests, the land and the sea. Jesus encourages us to 'consider the birds' in Matthew 6:25-26 and in Matthew 10:28-29. He who cares for the birds will care for you.
